prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The model is centered in the image. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.003, 0.0]. This configuration defines the orientation and position of the 2D sketch plane. Sketch Inside the newly created coordinate system, perform the following tasks to create the sketch: Face 1 * Create a new face named "face\\_1". * For "face\\_1", create a loop with the following four lines: 1. Draw a line (line\\_1) connecting Point [0.0, 0.0] and Point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line (line\\_2) connecting Point [0.75, 0.0] and Point [0.75, 0.0886]. 3. Draw a line (line\\_3) connecting Point [0.75, 0.0886] and Point [0.0, 0.0886]. 4. Draw a line (line\\_4) connecting Point [0.0, 0.0886] and Point [0.0, 0.0]. These lines form a closed rectangular loop. * In "face\\_1", create four additional loops with the given circles: 1. For "loop\\_2", create a circle (circle\\_1) with Center [0.15, 0.0443] and Radius 0.0015. 2. For "loop\\_3", create a circle (circle\\_1) with Center [0.3, 0.0443] and Radius 0.0015. 3. For "loop\\_4", create a circle (circle\\_1) with Center [0.45, 0.0443] and Radius 0.0015. 4. For "loop\\_5", create a circle (circle\\_1) with Center [0.6, 0.0443] and Radius 0.0015. There will be five loops in total in "face\\_1", four circles, and one rectangle. Extrusion Now, extrude the created sketch: * Set **extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal** to 0.003. * Set **extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal** to 0.0. * Set **sketch\\_scale** to 0.75. * Set the **operation** as 'Create a new solid body'. Dimensions The height, width, and length of the rectangular prism are as follows: - Height: 0.75. - Width: 0.003. - Length: 0.75. Confidence: 94%</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1** Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center. The hole is slightly larger than the cylinder's diameter. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of 0 degrees, 0 degrees, and -90 degrees, and a translation vector of (0.05, 0.1911, 0.05). Sketch the part on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Start with the outer boundary of the hole. Create an arc with a start point at (0.1208, 0.2917), a mid point at (0, 0), and an end point at (0.2917, 0.1208). Follow this with a line from (0.2917, 0.1208) to (0.4246, 0.1968), another line from (0.4246, 0.1968) to (0.4246, 0.2917), and a final line from (0.4246, 0.2917) back to (0.1208, 0.2917) to close the loop. For the inner boundary of the hole, create a circle with a center at (0.1208, 0.1208) and a radius of 0.1139. The sketch for this part consists of two faces, one for the outer boundary and one for the inner boundary. Each face has one loop. The first loop has four lines and two arcs, and the second loop has one circle. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.0949 units and along the opposite direction of the normal by 0.0949 units to create the 3D model. Use a sketch scale of 0.4246 for the operation. **Instructions for Part 2** Construct a three-dimensional, symmetrical, triangular shape with a hole in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of 0 degrees, 0 degrees, and 180 degrees, and a translation vector of (0.3987, 0.381, 0.2468). Sketch the part on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Start with the outer boundary. Create an arc with a start point at (0, 0.0748), a mid point at (0.0176, 0.0262), and an end point at (0.0624, 0.0001). Follow this with a series of lines and arcs to complete the shape. The full sequence of curves is: arc, line, line, arc, line, arc, line, arc, line, line, arc. The sketch for this part consists of two faces, one on the top and one on the bottom of the shape. Each face has one loop. The first loop has ten curves, and the second loop has one circle. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.1235 units to create the 3D model. Do not extrude in the opposite direction of the normal. Use a sketch scale of 0.3799 for the operation. The final shape, after the parts have been combined, will be a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a curved surface. The cylinder has a smaller cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions of this shape are as follows: length 0.4246 units, width 0.3799 units, and height 0.4246 units.</description>
